text: Hey everyone, does the github deploy in the boilerplate work? I’ve created secrets for the Portal ID and added in the portal number, same for access key but when pushing to main branch it doesn’t deploy to the HubSpot account
<@U3T21PDBK> Just seen you mention PostCSS here, its something our dev team have been talking about. Have you got any exp with adding it to HubSpot boilerplate?
Good news for you, <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/package.json#L11|the boilerplate already has it included>
check out the autoprefixor script. You’ll probs want a postcss config file for more complicated stuff though
<@U024XMKQ3PD> <@U3T21PDBK> I recently made some posts about setting up HubSpot + Webpack + PostCSS + Tailwind here: <https://www.fasterbetter.dev/>
interesting to see the postcss-cli in the boilerplate...I've noticed that if I just normally run CSS + Hubl through postcss it throws an error
oh, I see, you're skipping those files in autoprefixer
<@UGMGP7A72> it works for me. Are you getting any errors? Do you see it in Github actions?
